history.content:
CS 70 + CS 61C is a very common combination for fall sophomores, nice balance between a pset class and a project-oriented class. A bit higher workload however.

CS 70 + EECS 16b technically should have a lower workload, but it's two pset classes and EECS 16b has the potential to be a real headache.

I don't have experience with Data 100, but from what I've heard I'm assuming it has a lower workload than 61C and a higher workload than 16B.

Overall? I'd recommend 61C + 70, especially if you're looking to take CS classes like 162 in the near future. However, if you are one of the few folks interested in the EE side of things, taking 16B would allow you to get started on those kind of classes earlier.

I don't have experience with Data 100, but from what I've heard I'm assuming it has a lower workload than 61C and a higher workload than 16B.

children.subject: Taking CS70 and EECS16B together is gonna make you despise math.

history.content:
Currently I am a freshman. I am taking cs 61a and eecs 16a and plan to take cs 61bl over summer. So, I will be left with cs 70, eecs 16b and cs 61c. I want to take cs 70 in fall, what other course should I take with it in fall - eecs 16b, cs 61c, or data c100?

thanks!
history.subject: Lower division course selection
